page.title: 18 THE OLD RAILWAY LINE
page.content: There is a disused railway track running through a small part of our area.It was started in 1863 and took over five years to be built.The railway line was a single line which ran from Braintree to Dunmow and then to Bishops Stortford. In the early part of the 19th century some farmers used to buy Welsh cattle for summer grazing they were then put on to a truck at the station to be driven by rail to North Essex and Suffolk.During the first world war alot of hay was brought by wagon and traction engine for the military.The soldiers used to help put the hay on to the wagons. As the times changed and people got other kinds of transport the railway line closed down in 1952 and the tracks were taken up in 1970. Today people use the old track as a walk.
